item.title: The Spine of Scripture with Dominic Bnonn Tennant [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week P Nate has a special guest lined up all the way from New Zealand. From the future, Dominic Bnonn Tennant, Husband, Father, Pastor, Author, Theologian comes on to discuss his paradigm shifting book The Spine of Scripture. You can follow Bnonns blog at bnonn.com or his co-work with Dr. Michael Foster at https://itsgoodtobeaman.com/.

item.title: Election Apologetics [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
P Nate and Elder P sit down without an agenda and talk through some of the implications of the doctrines of grace. In a new church family there will be differences of opinion with some key doctrines so the Rebels discuss what leads them, biblically and practically to embrace and love reformed soteriology.

item.title: End Abortion - It Starts Right Now! [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week P Nate and Pootie invite a guest to Garage Mahal. Right Now president and co-founder Scott Hayward joins the guys to discuss the current state of abortion laws in Canada and how you can help fight to end the murder of preborn children in Canada.

www.itstartsrightnow.ca  to join Right Now.

For more information on abortion visit the Canadian Centre for Bio-ethical Reform website at 

https://www.endthekilling.ca/

item.title: Paradigm Shifts in Faith: Atonement is not enough (Part 1) [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
Today the Rebels sit down to top off their mini series about paradigm shifts in their faith and theology and discuss some of the principles that came out of an excellent book (we recommend) called The Spine of Scripture by Domonic Bnonn Tennant.

 

There Bnonn Tennant makes the controversial statement that modern evangelism preaches atonement at the expense of enthronement!

 

Join P Nate, #1 and Air Jordan as they discuss the kingdom of God, Lordship of Christ and the advance of the Christian gospel!

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
item.author: Pastors Nate & Chris Plus Air Jordan
item.itunes:author: Pastors Nate & Chris Plus Air Jordan

item.title: Paradigm Shifts in Faith: Biblical Cosmology [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
Continuing in our series about biblical doctrines that, once embraced, massively change the Christian worldview and how Christians interact with the culture around them, P Nate, #1 and Air-Jordan return to Garage-Mahal ready to talk about the divine council and biblical cosmology.

What are we to make of angels, demons, principalities, pagan gods and more importantly, how has God structured the hierarchy of the cosmos? What does the Bible reveal and how does it change how we engage?

Some excellent resources on the topic for your further study:

  • The Spine of Scripture by Domonic Bnonn Tennant
  • The Forgotten Heavens (multiple authors but edited and compiled by Doug Wilson)
  • The Unseen Realm by Dr. Michael Heiser

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: Debriefing the Church at War Conference [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
Last week the Rebels got a chance to travel to Waterloo and Trinity Bible Chapel for the Church at War Conference.

The conference featured many of the courageous pastors and congregants who stood up to the covid tyranny, kept the doors to their churches open and were fined and imprisoned for it. On top of the wonderful time sharing the word and encouraging like-minded brothers, the new documentary “Of Anti-Christ and his Ruin” was featured.

 

P Nate, #1 and Air-Jordan weigh in on the conference, the doc and what they took away.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: Paradigm Shifts in Faith: Patriarchy, the Church and Women [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week the Rebels open up a can of worms If this is the last episode you ever listen to, well, its been fun!
 
A paradigm shift is a fundamental change in thinking or assumptions. Certain doctrines, when discovered in scripture or embraced in the life of a believer have the potential to change EVERYTHING!
 
P Nate and Pootie, #1, as well as Air Jordan stay on the topic of patriarchy but apply it to church, ecclesiology and the role of women... buckle up!
 
To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/
 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: Paradigm Shifts in Faith: From Complementarianism to Patriarchy [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week the Rebels continue the new mini series started last week about Paradigm Shifts in faith and doctrine.

 

A paradigm shift is a fundamental change in thinking or assumptions. Certain doctrines, when discovered in scripture or embraced in the life of a believer have the potential to change EVERYTHING!

 

In the second installment of this fun series P Nate, #1 and Air Jordan are back in Garage-Mahal to discuss why Complementarianism is not enough... and how they’ve transitioned from a pretty complementarian lite- to a rich and robust Patricarchical view of the World.

item.title: Interview With A Real Theologian [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
It’s still summer holiday time with the Rebels.  Today we look back way back to August 2017.  It was the Rebels’ 105thpodcast, and Nate & Chris were like kids in a candy shop over the guest they were going to interview.  Who was that guest?  It was the famous father, theologian, author, podcaster, blogger, and all-round Big Eva disruptor – Douglas Wilson!  Listen in to see how well the Rebels were able to keep their composure.

item.title: The Pro Life Way Of Life [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
It’s summer holiday time with the Rebels.  Today we look back to February 2020, just before the big bad pandemic came along.  Then, as today, abortion ranks high on the list of things the left is fighting tooth and nail to preserve.  Pastor Nate talks with Jonathan Van Maren about his work in the pro life movement.

item.title: Evangelical Feminism, Gender Roles & Traditional Marriage [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
It’s summer holiday time with the Rebels, so today we take a listen back 90 episodes to January 2019 when the topic was feminism, gender roles and traditional marriage.  We see that these issues have become even more controversial today.  Fortunately the truth, God’s truth, has not changed, and because God designed us, we work best when we obey his Word.

This week P Nate and #1 take the time to dismantle a few BAD arguments they are seeing Christians engage with poorly as well as giving you a bit more ammunition in your magazine.

item.title: Talk to yourself more than you listen to yourself [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
In another effort to get really practical, P Nate and Pootie discuss another strategy often talked about in Pastoral counseling: the issue of controlling your thought-life.

 

Many Churches and Christians have an improper understanding of spiritual warfare. At the core, spiritual warfare is a battle over who, or what controls your thinking. In this episode the rebels discuss how to train your mind to think Christianly.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: Tell A Better Story [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week P Nate and Pootie tackle a subject that has been the focal point of many pastoral care sessions over the years.

 

In pastoral counseling Nate will often be asked how parents can keep their kids free from the entanglement of the world, the LGBT agenda, the lure of bad friend groups etc. The advice given applies equally though to having fulfilling marriages, thriving churches, great communities and even dynamic businesses.

 

The answer is simple, but requires explanation: Tell a better story.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
item.author: Pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels

item.title: Are we living in the New Heavens and New Earth? [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
One of the most used and yet most misunderstood passages of the last two years is Romans 13:1-5 – BUT what about all time? Well, we think understanding the new heavens and the new earth ranks pretty high up there.

 

Most Christians believe we are waiting for the new heavens/earth to be created after this earth is destroyed! If that’s true, is heaven going to be destroyed too? Is that how the new testament uses the word “new”? And why does Isaiah say that people die on the “new earth”?

 

We have questions! And hopefully some answers too!

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
item.author: Pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels

item.title: Pootie Plays The Prophet [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
One of the questions we seem to get a lot these days is a speculative question asking what we think the next several years/ decades will look like in North America, and more specifically here in Canada.

 

It is no secret that things have been rough. The last two years we have seen: Lockdowns that not only caused depression, anxiety, domestic abuse, drug overdose, pornography addiction and a host of other issues to skyrocket, but we saw the doors to churches closed so those affected could not get the help they needed; Government overreach and corruption sail to new heights; Small businesses destroyed, livelihoods taken, critical race theory infect every area of social, educational and political life, vaccine mandates take away freedom over invasive medical decisions and the list goes on...

 

First of all how does this trajectory fit together with a theology of historical optimism? And secondly, how do we see the next few years playing out in the culture?

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
item.author: pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels
item.itunes:author: pastor Nate & Chris - The Rebels

item.title: One Fear To Rule Them All [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
This week P Nate and Pootie use the monkey-pox scare as a jumping off point to talk about FEAR. Fear has gripped many throughout this pandemic, but it’s not just fear of covid. Some fear covid, others fear the government, some fear the future of our nation and others fear the state of the church... it’s one thing to be concerned, but being fearful is not an option for Christians who believe in the Sovereignty of God... we are called to have one fear that rules all others... the FEAR of God.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: Equipped For Roe V Wade Conversations [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
With the leaked Supreme Court decision and the overturning of Roe v Wade there will be no shortage of opportunities for Christians to engage in this topic. Conversations are popping up with the news and the glee and anger being expressed from various media outlets around the world. 

 

P Nate and Pootie will leave the legal analysis and cultural predictions to more capable folks... but what we want to do is help equip YOU for conversations as you faithfully look for opportunities to engage the culture and those in it in your sphere of influence.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

item.title: Gentle And Lowly Is Not Enough [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
There is a great book making its rounds in North American Evangelicalism called Gentle and Lowly by Dane Ortlund. It’s a good (not great) book. But is it the RIGHT book?

 

Jesus chastised the Pharisees for failing to read the signs of their times... of course Christ was gentle and lowly, but he was also bold and courageous... which Christ-like characteristics are most needed for the times in which God has placed us?

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: A Call To NOT Flee [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
There is a theology of fleeing. Jesus said when we are persecuted in one town to flee to the next... many like-minded Christians have already begun to think through whether the loss of personal liberties, coercive vaccine measures and slide towards totalitarian communism is enough to motivate us to seek greener (and more importantly freer) pastures elsewhere.

 

In this episode P Nate and Pootie argue that Christians should stay put and fight.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
item.author: Pastor Nate & Chris Poots
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate & Chris Poots

item.title: Recanting & Reviewing [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
After some pushback on our episode defending Joe Boot and Theonomy, P Nate and Pootie talk about whether some things in that episode crossed a line, which leads to some conversation about when and how to use a ‘serrated edge’ while confronting brothers. 

 

The duo then go on to talk about what it’s like to say hard things in a culture that is used to squishy things... which leads to discussing some recent(ish) news events that they haven’t had a chance to weigh in on.

 

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.title: A Community Unto Ourselves [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
With the world in upheaval it seems like very few things matter as much as Christian community. When it comes to the call to be a “city on a hill”, what does that look like for local churches and how can we best position ourselves when the pressure of the State starts closing in from all sides?

To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Joe Boot, Theonomy and revenge of the beta males [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
P Nate and Pootie are back in Garage-Mahal ready to defend not only the theological orthodoxy of theonomy but of friend and mentor Dr. JOE Boot.
 
A lot has been said over the last year and much criticism has been directed at Joe, the Institute and Theonomy as a whole. Is it warranted? Is theonomy dangerous? Do those hurling insults even understand the position?
 
... or is it not really about theonomy at all?
 
After recording this episode (but before we posted it) Joe and the boys at Ezra did their own podcast and rebuttal which can be found here: https://www.ezrainstitute.com/resource-library/podcast/more-objections-to-theonomy/
 
To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/ 
 

You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel

item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Wright & Chris Poots

item.title: Discerning Media & Misinformation [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
P Nate and Pootie come out of semi-retirement in order to talk through the bombardment of lies being propagated in the culture.
 
From election coverage, to covid information, the trucker convoy and now War in Ukraine propaganda we see more and more Christians forgetting an inescapable concept: there is no neutrality.
 
We are called to be discerning truth seekers... how can we do that?
 
To support the show you can become a Fight Laugh Feast Club Member here: flfnetwork.com/membership/ 
 
You can also join the rebellion by sharing and inviting your friends to like the content on facebook: facebook.com/rebelpodcast or by supporting us through patreon at patreon.com/reformedrebel
